result.execSummary:
The defendant Morgan Gm Meyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500) [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).
  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500) [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Irrevocable Assignment of Bail

# 1 - Itemization/Value estimates
# 2 - Print out of watch value

Defendant Morgan Gm Meyer in court with attorney John Miller Carroll.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 9:03 a.m. State advises that victim is present and ready to testify. State is willing to assist, but is not required to participate. Victim has burden of proof as to value. Statement by Atty Carroll. J.M. duly sworn on oath, testifies. Ex 1 - itemization/value estimates. Recess 9:11. Resume  9:16. J.M. continues testimony. Ex 2 - printout of watch value. Statement/arguments by J.M. Statement by D.A. Constable. Arguments by Atty Carroll. Responses by J.M. and State. Findings and remarks by the Court. No objection to Court receiving exhibits. Court orders $15,000.00 restitution. Court has already ordered payment of restitution as a condition of probation, will not put any further parameters on payment. Exhibits 1 & 2 received. Adjourn 9:56. Recall @ 9:58 a.m. Same appearances. Court addresses issue of bonds being held. State asks bonds be applied to restitution. Statement by Atty Carroll. Court reviews acknowledgment signed by bond poster and minutes from sentencing hearing. Statement by bond poster, requests half be returned. Court orders $1,000 returned to poster, balance to restitution.   (Reviewed with Judge Rhode, document filed by Atty Carroll in regards to bond,  balance to be returned to Atty Carroll)
DNA Proof of Submission
DNA Order and Acknowledgement

Defendant Morgan Gm Meyer in court with attorney John Miller Carroll.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 11:18 am.  Atty Carroll gives agreement, 3 years probation, Restitution is not resolved.  State heard on bail bond forfeiture be applied to restitution.  Victim is present in court  amend to 2 ct's Class A misdemeanor with repeater, State gives prior convictions, 943.34(1)(a) with <2500, 939.62(1)(a) repeater .State is not agreeing to limit of Restitution reserve right to ask for amount over 10,000. Court allow amendment to ct 1 and will add ct 2 same as ct 1.  Costs only and DNA surcharge, Restitution to be determined and reserve right. No contact with victim or residence.  Employed full time and counseling deemed by agent.  Early discharge if restitution paid in full and may be transferred.  Recess @ 11:25 am.  Reconvene @ 11:46 am. 5 days credit.  Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights filed.   Def. understands charges and penalties. Ct's 1 & 2 Receiving Stolen Property <2500, repeater, no contest plea. Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights.  Def. understands elements.  Def. admits prior convictions. Atty Carroll is satisfied.  Court finds plea is freely & voluntarily given.  Factual basis agreed.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and finds def. Guilty to Receiving Stolen Propery <2500 as repeater in Ct's 1 & 2.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  J.M. victim makes statement.  Atty Carroll gives sentencing recommendation.  Def. has nothing to say.  Court orders  
Ct 1 withheld sentence 3 years probation, court costs, 200 DNA surcharge and DNA Sample, May transfer probation.
Ct 2 withheld sentence 3 years probation,  costs, 200 DNA Surcharge, Conditions: No contact with victim or residence, Counseling deemed by agent, Maintain full time employment or apply for 5 jobs a week, 5 days credit if revoked.
 If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advised of postconviction rights.  Restitution to be determined within 60 days.  Restitution may exceed over 5,000.  Bonds will remain withhold ruling on bonds.  Restitution hearing scheduled for May 3, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Morgan Gm Meyer in court, in custody and via-video.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin, by telephone.  Court calls  @ 1:40 pm.  State argues that hearing should not be held today and will deal with it tomorrow.  Court hangs up with State bad connection.  State heard nothing from defendants attorney.  Def. heard on bond.  Court can't modify bond without State available. Court will call tomorrow at 1:00 pm.  Hearing scheduled for January 17, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: State's

Defendant Morgan Gm Meyer in court with attorney Bradley John Priebe, by telephone.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls  @ 11:03 am. Atty Priebe is requesting to withdraw from case, however, things have changed. Atty Priebe is now withdrawing request. Atty Priebe waives ph. Def. agrees with Atty Priebe request. Def. does not object to proceed today with Atty Priebe on phone.  Court goes over preliminary examination form with def.   Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause. Information Filed.  Def. has copy of information. Atty Priebe waives reading, reserve appearance and enters Not Guilty plea. Court receives Not Guilty plea and directs Clerk to enter.  Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Bradley John Priebe in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 1:15 pm. Atty Priebe has does not have copy of complaint, enters special appearance and waives time limits.  Atty given copy of complaint.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2016 at 11:00 am.
